reviewText:
Zero Gear is a cart combat multiplayer online party game. Its more than eight player racing, the maps have a variety of objectives such as three-on-three European and American football. There are battle modes such as using boxing gloves to knock other cars over the edge of a sumo ring into the abyss below. Other maps are skeeball and even a pachinko machine with your cars. Its a true party game for anyone that has seven other friends online with this budget game. The game does offer a four pack for the price of two, which is always incentive. If you have no friends, the real problem is that five years after its release, there is no one playing.

The game plays easy with an accelerator, a nitro boost, a mini jump for sharper turns. You can gain nitro by drafting behind other competitors or touching a floating dreidel. In fact almost touching it is good enough. The boost will put you at your top speed in an instant rather than slowly increasing speed or shooting you forward, so its just as useful to use the boost when you've got the minimum or maximum amount. In other words, just hold down that boost button. If you ever fall off a track or stray too far from the path, you can use a respawn button. There is optional full mouse camera support and even a free aim button so you can target another competitor.

Like all cart combat games you have weapons. In this case there are two buttons to use a weapon in front or behind you. Its shallow in term of weapon variety and you get them by driving through hovering boxes. There is a bubble shield, a boxing glove, a pink love robot that will follow and then hug on the nearest driver until it explodes. You can also get a mine to drop, and a tornado that will throw anyone caught in its winds. Ice blocks will freeze an enemy and send them gliding forward with no ability to turn. Even frozen in ice, their tires will spin, so that feels like an overlooked detail.

Perhaps the most context sensitive item to use is the spring that lets you jump. While the spring can be used to jump over things, I consider this to be more useful for doing backflips and barrel rolls to get more boost. When you're in the air with any jump, you have full tilt control of your vehicle.

If you're all alone you can play with bots, but victories feel hollow without a single player campaign or cup of any sort. You can setup quick matches and assign the fifteen events you want to play. With the quick matches its just you and three other bots playing the same even twice for whatever reason before you progress to the next map. You can always setup a more complex server, but it takes a bit longer.

In terms of customization, you have a lot to chose from. Your car, your gear, your helmet and your face wear. Everything is customization and adds a lot of silly character to the game to make you stand out from the pack online. You can be a hovering brain wearing a clown nose with blonde pig tails driving a boat car. A nice option is randomization, so you can end up with a pink squid wearing a moon helmet driving a bomb with spike tires. Speaking of spike tires, when you use them, you can tell if you let off the accelerator the tires stop completely even if you continue to move forward.

As for the tracks themselves, the races are all closed circuits with only two or three laps. The shortest course has eight laps, but it feels like a strict circle.The driving surfaces are needlessly wide so the focus is more on the weapons instead of the driving skill. Each course has a few ramps and jumps here and there. You'll even go down a bumpy ski slope, a wavy slide and a water slide. Each course is bright and colorful. Its all very appealing to the eyes to make that quick fun joy ride feeling.

There's a lot of creativity with the courses, a pool and water slide, driving on a billiard tapble that connects to an air hockey course. Even the standard race track circuit shows a lot of flair. The desert themed track has you racing outside and then through a crystal mine across wooden roads. The creativity and effort shows, but the thing that holds the design back in my eyes are the lack of hazards. There's a dirt stadium that could use some slowing mud. These wide tracks just need something else on them like a shallow river. The water park has a lot of water, but it has no affect on you even if the water slide can rotate you backward as you go down..

Then there are quirky events such as the basketball, American and European football events that have you trying to score a goal with a gigantic sports ball. While I like the idea, the practice of it in Zero Gear is lacking, its dull and imprecise. Speaking of dull, nothing can trump the tag chase event in terms of boredom. The tag chase has a timer where only one person's time increases. The one that fills their meter first wins the event. Well this takes forever, because everyone else's meter goes down. To make things interesting, the mode will change where the one that is it will decrease in time, making a long mode even longer. These cars are so tiny on such an open wide map that its tough to tag anyone. If the person that's it falls off the level, its up for grabs in the center again.

While a lot of the other events are fun and unique, they feel thrown together such as the pachinko and skeeball games. These are simple games based on points. You use your car to drive off a cliff or ramp and fall down into the pachinko or fly into the skeeball. The skeeball feels like skill, the pachinko feels like dumb luck. This is strictly filler content to flaunt as a frill.

There is controller support, just not in the menus. Default controls needed to be adjusted because some of the buttons were forgotten about. Even adjusting the controls, there is no menu button to adjust, so there's no pause with a controller. In fact there is no pause, because an online game keeps going even with bots. Instead there's a menu with no way to rebind the menu.

Zero Gear feels like it can benefit from from better events and a single player series of races against more intelligent opponents. There is something good here, but it needs to go deeper and bigger. More weapons, more races, more hazards. I'm sure it was fun when its multiplayer was still alive, but with such a small budget game, I wonder how alive it ever was. The game lives and dies on its multiplayer. Judging from the 25% of people with the first achievement, people went into the game, saw that its multiplayer only and went right back out.

reviewText:
It can be better.

This is a little fun kart game with very little standout. It is reminiscent of Mario Kart games where the idea of using weapons is one of the essential keys to getting that 1st place. It's got a nice look going for it and it does have potential to be one of the best kart games out there.

However, it definitely needs more work on it or some patchwork for it to be better than it is now. First thing to start with is definitely the A.I. While the A.I is suitably well to give you a challenge to race against, it really falls short on other modes. Notably on levels where you're playing Football or Soccer. I've watched the CPU controlled teammates do a lot of piling up with eachother and very minimal strategy involved for scoring a goal.

Also I've noticed they favor the idea of running into you and eachother a lot as well as bumble around with the ball or puck than trying to get it in the goal. Without them being distracted. Also, your team mates favor the idea of running into you more often than avoiding and focusing primarily on the opposing team with you. While the A.I does get the idea of what it's supposed to do in these modes, it doesn't really make it fun or challenging when it's more of a fight with stupidity than competing.

There's no difficulty setting for this game either so you're stuck with the A.I having moodswings every now and then. One small complaint about the goal-levels is that, why have powerups that would be useful for the racing aspect of the game in them? It makes a lot of sense to have the boxing glove powerup for areas like Sumo and Soccer. But you're really wishing it could be in Football sometimes. It'd add a nice touch if you want to score more.

There's a decent amount of customization in this game. From picking a character, what your kart looks like, what accessories you wear and to a nice color changing pallette. Although it wouldn't hurt to have more to add to the variety. Like changing the color of your character, that'd be nice.

Control-wise, it's easy to get used to. Also you can change it to whatever you're comfortable with.

Gameplay is decent however the physics could also use a little tightening. Everything feels...loose. It's easy to lose to control, it's easy to get knocked around, it's a pain to go in reverse and that camera is awful. It's only awful when you're going in reverse, where it has to turn around and face the front of your character instead of allowing you to simply back up while facing ahead. I hate games that do that.

Graphics are okay and the sound is awesome. But again I wish for more!

Multiplayer is pretty much left to be desired. The community is still somewhat of a ghost town, you may find one or two friends to play with. But, getting a full server with this game that aren't bots is considerably a challenge.

In conclusion this game can be so much better. If it would add more customization, tighter controls/gameplay, more variety modes, difficulty settings, maybe add cups or a tournament mode and definitely a better A.I.

I rate this game 5 out of 10. I would recommend it but however if you want more in-depth with your games like I would. Then, I can't recommend this game.

reviewText:
Right, so first things first, if that trailer doesn't make you feel insaaaaaaane then.... well, actually, thats understandable. Zero Gear is probably one of the funniest racing games I have ever played. I have never played a mario kart game in my life, due to the fact I own nothing intendo, but I have always wanted to play one. I found this waaaaaaaay back when they had a free weekend of this to promote their game, and I gave it a go. I will never regret that day.

I had soooo much fun online, back when it worked, and I pooped in my pants every once in a while because I laughed so hard. Now days I don't do that so much, but i still manage a fart whenever I play this game.

The tracks are awesome, some better than others. The racing is the best. The AI is top notch. The vehicle customisation is state-of-the-art. And the PHYSICS in this game is far more advanced than the physics that occupy this world currently. I mean, how many times can you slightly nudge your friend ever-so-lightly on the back of his car, THEN HE FLIPS, AND CRIES, AND ♥♥♥♥♥ ALL IN THE SAME SWIFT MOVEMENT?!?! that's right, you can't, but this game makes it possible.

Now, I dont write a lot of reviews, so, you can trust me on this. Zero Gear is where I have had most of my laughs in gaming. I used to laugh at a lot of stuff back when I was younger, now I find things relatively hard to laugh at if it isnt extremely funny. Like ducks for example, I barley laugh at those anymore.

Anyway,

If you are looking for a racing game with great graphics, excellent car handling, a solid NFS story, an aboriginal, several quails, and realistic... well... realism, then LOOK ELSEWHERE.

However, if you are looking for a game with good laughs, great fun, extreme competition, rage quitting (when you nudge your ♥♥♥♥♥♥ off friend because he hasn't won a race since he started playing), 10/10 -IGN physics, and a good game to play with friends, then ZERO GEAR is the campfire you want to gather around on a cold winters night. Its funny when you play, but most of all, its FUN. I enjoyed it. That guy below me enjoyed it. So why shouldnt YOU enjoy it?

Buy it. NOW!

LEGIT STUFF NOW:
As I said, the game is great, and extremely funny, but ONLY if you have about 3-4 friends to play this with. Bots are OK, but you always win and there isnt really a challenge.

PROS:
-Very funny
-Lots of different tracks/maps
-Lots of different game modes
-Good customization
-Graphics are good for the style and time of the game
-Very quirky and fun
-Awesome powerups
-BOTS in multiplayer (If you would like. Personally, I enjoy having them)
-AWESOME music
-THE PHYSICS

CONS:
-No online play (Thats why you HAVE to have friends to play this game with)
-Some maps are very long and boring (these are far a few between though)
-Sometimes it gets laggy
-No developer input
-No community
-Bot AI is sometimes really f*cking weird.... sometimes...
-THE PHYSICS

Overall and EXCELLENT game. Very fun but only with friends. No community or online play (Servers).
9/10 (Because sometimes the physics can really ♥♥♥♥ you off)

reviewText: There is a reason they are giving it away for free. There is not a single person playing this multiplayer cart racer. The character customization is awesome and the best part of the game. I chose a gentleman cactus riding a tank. The racing mechanics are pretty bland. They don't tell you there is a different button to drop the item, and a different button to shoot the same item, which goes against any other racing game. They should make it more clear. Most of the items are just droppables that you can also shoot, then there are worthless items like the spring. There is a shield but since there, for some reason, isn't a way to look back you don't know when to use it so its worthless. There are a lot of levels and game modes which is nice. Problem is although levels look different, there aren't any obstables or level specific things, its just what you are riding on changes. They should have taken note from Mario Kart. So you just drive around and go off jumps. Driving mechanics are poor. You take super wide turns and can't quick turn if you are stopped. Also most times you land you just spin out for some reason, or if you just tap the wall. Also going up a ramp and coming back down you can't turn in the air, so you just land and stop, which makes no sense. There are modes like tag and soccer, which are cool. unfortunately the bots suck and will for some reason your teamates will take the soccer ball/basketball/etc, away from the opponents side and push it towards yours (derp?). Not much to see here. 4.5/10

Most of the items are just droppables that you can also shoot, then there are worthless items like the spring. There is a shield but since there, for some reason, isn't a way to look back you don't know when to use it so its worthless. There are a lot of levels and game modes which is nice. Problem is although levels look different, there aren't any obstables or level specific things, its just what you are riding on changes. They should have taken note from Mario Kart. So you just drive around and go off jumps. Driving mechanics are poor. You take super wide turns and can't quick turn if you are stopped. Also most times you land you just spin out for some reason, or if you just tap the wall. Also going up a ramp and coming back down you can't turn in the air, so you just land and stop, which makes no sense. There are modes like tag and soccer, which are cool. unfortunately the bots suck and will for some reason your teamates will take the soccer ball/basketball/etc, away from the opponents side and push it towards yours (derp?). Not much to see here. 4.5/10
